channel.title: About on ETIENNE MA
channel.description: Recent content in About on ETIENNE MA

item.title: Message in a Bottle
item.description: üçº Message In a Bottle # In close collaboration with Danny Witters, Tim Wei, and Han Yang Lee. Thousands of strangers leave voicemails for each other.¬†What do they say? Message in a Bottle was an anonymous hotline that let strangers leave voicemails for each other. Each caller left a message; then they heard what the previous caller left behind. We left hundreds of placards with the phone number in San Francisco, New York City, London, and Sao Paulo‚Äîout on the streets, in bathrooms, in parks‚Äîand over 3000 people dialed in, leaving messages that were surprising, creative, vulnerable, and often delightful.

item.title: Pillars of Reflection
item.description: üí≠ Pillars of Reflection # In close collaboration with Tim Wei Tim and I built Pillars of Reflection as part of the Market Street Prototyping Festival organized by San Francisco Planning and Yerba Buena Center for the Arts.¬†Pillars was a mirror installation designed to get people to stop for a moment as they walked along Market Street.¬†The Pillars were the subject of many curious stares, selfies, smiles, and even a birthday celebration.

item.title: The Breakup Coloring Book
item.description: üíî The Breakup Coloring Book # In close collaboration with Fu Le and Leon Lin. The Breakup Coloring Book is filled with wise sayings from cultures all around the world‚Äîthings that people say to comfort people who have just broken up. Things like ‚Äúthere‚Äôs plenty of fish in the sea‚Äù (English) and ‚Äúthere are orange trees elsewhere that grow oranges‚Äù (Greek) and ‚Äúdon’t give up the entire forest for a single tree‚Äù (Chinese).

item.title: Likemind
item.description: üß† Likemind # Who’s reading the same books as me? An experiment conducted over five hundred notecards, each with the message above, placed in books that have resonated with me.¬†The notecards are scattered across book shops, thrift stores, and libraries in Philadelphia, New York, Boston, Providence, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Salt Lake City, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Sydney, and Melbourne. To date, 23 folks have reached out to say hi.
